text: Angkor Wat the largest temple on earth
this massive structure dominates the
jungle landscape of northern Cambodia
but why did the ancient Cambodians build
this temple so much bigger than any
other Simon Warrick has spent decades
investigating Angkor Wat and its
surrounding temples he believes the
answer to this mystery lies in decoding
the intricate carvings that adorn the
temple walls we're in the third
enclosure of the temple of Angkor Wat
and in this enclosure we have more than
half a mile of carved bas reliefs the
carvings tell the story of the ancient
civilization who built the temple the
Khmer they depict the Army's military
victories and they give us an image of a
great ruler King Suryavarman ii so here
we are in front of king serum and ii
himself this is the first portrait of a
Khmer King in history of Khmer art here
he is sitting on his throne looking very
regal surrounded by his counselors and
his ministers several holy men and
wonderful umbrellas to shield him from
the Sun fans fly whisks all the
accoutrements of royalty here critically
King Suryavarman wasn't born to rule he
had seized power from his great uncle
and Simon is convinced that angkor wats
huge size was a grand political
statement to win over his new subjects
carved here is the message that the king
wanted to get to his people in a way
this is the campaign ad for Syria among
the 2nd Suria vermin didn't just want to
be seen as a rightful king he wanted to
be revered as a God so he built a temple
with an extraordinary secret that links
it to the heavens each year at the
spring equinox the Sun rises directly
over the central tower
[Music]
a hole in the capstone focuses the
sunlight down into the temple it shines
through a hole in the floor below and
down a 90-foot shaft to a secret chamber
deep underground some experts believe
that story a vermin designed this secret
vault to hold his mortal remains if
they're right Angkor Wat is not just a
temple
it's a spiritual machine to elevate the
god-king to his rightful heavenly throne
[Music]
